description:
Added RequestSubsystem(), according to RFC 4254 Section 6.5. It requests the association of a subsystem with the ssh session on the remote host.
A subsystem is a predefined command that runs in the background when the ssh session is initiated.

messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com, gustav.paul@gmail.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go.crypto/

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com, agl@golang.org (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com, gustav.paul@gmail.com),

Please take another look.

LGTM.

I don't see you in AUTHORS. Have you agreed to the CLA? http://golang.org/doc/contribute.html#copyright

On 2012/06/18 14:43:27, agl1 wrote:
> LGTM.
> 
> I don't see you in AUTHORS. Have you agreed to the CLA?
> http://golang.org/doc/contribute.html#copyright

Sorry, I missed that. I have agreed to the CLA just now.

On Mon, Jun 18, 2012 at 10:50 AM,  <ChHansmann@gmail.com> wrote:
> Sorry, I missed that. I have agreed to the CLA just now.
>
> http://codereview.appspot.com/6295096/

Thanks. I'll add you.

Could you also elaborate a little in the changelist description?
Subsystems are used for sftp and such, right? I think mentioning that
as the motivating example would be useful.


Cheers

AGL

*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=7369c049acc1&repo=crypto ***

ssh: added RequestSubsystem().

RequestSubsystem requests the association of a subsystem with the ssh
session on the remote host. A subsystem is a predefined command that
runs in the background when the ssh session is initiated (i.e. sftp).

R=golang-dev, agl
CC=golang-dev, gustav.paul
http://codereview.appspot.com/6295096

Committer: Adam Langley <agl@golang.org>

subject: code review 6295096: Added RequestSubsystem(), according to RFC 4254 Section...
